metadata.title: CVE-2014-3634 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
rsyslog before 7.6.6 and 8.x before 8.4.1 and sysklogd 1.5 and earlierallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), possiblyexecute arbitrary code, or have other unspecified impact via a craftedpriority (PRI) value that triggers an out-of-bounds array access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3634` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rsyslog - 7.4.4-1ubuntu2.3
rsyslog-gnutls - 7.4.4-1ubuntu2.3
rsyslog-gssapi - 7.4.4-1ubuntu2.3
rsyslog-mysql - 7.4.4-1ubuntu2.3
rsyslog-pgsql - 7.4.4-1ubuntu2.3
rsyslog-relp - 7.4.4-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rsyslog package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.4-1ubuntu2.3').
